value.0: <CUSTOM1711>Roll Skill Check - Please select the skill to check.
<CUSTOM1703>Nevermind, I do not want to use any commands at this time.

<CUSTOM1707><CUSTOM1716>skillslist <CUSTOM1705>= Sends a list of the skills and matching skill numbers to the players combat log, for easy reference when using the <CUSTOM1708><CUSTOM1716>skillcheck<CUSTOM1705> command to do skill checks.

<CUSTOM1707><CUSTOM1716>skillcheck <CUSTOM1705>= Allows players to roll checks against a specific skill and DC. The command format is <CUSTOM1708><CUSTOM1716>skillcheck (skill#) (DC#)<CUSTOM1705> . Example: A DC 20 Discipline Check would be spoken as follows: <CUSTOM1708><CUSTOM1716>skillcheck 3 20<CUSTOM1705> . The result will be displayed in floating text above the player. A list of skill numbers can be called up using the <CUSTOM1708><CUSTOM1716>skillslist<CUSTOM1705> command.
<CUSTOM1703>Nevermind, I do not want to use any commands at this time.
<CUSTOM1707><CUSTOM1716>partyroll <CUSTOM1705>= Does an arranged party loot split roll, if the command giver is the party leader.
